Articles.Content: Would it be okay legally if I distributed my gamedata for a multi-person project where I may have friends without ksp on the discord where I am distributing it? Without a working ksp install the gamedata should be useless, right?

Legally, assuming each and every mod has a license that permits it then yes it's legal.

Technically, it's probably easier to use CKAN to install the mods and then just distribute the exported list, which is also 100% legal no matter what the mods' licenses are. That of course assumes all the mods are on CKAN but the vast majority of the popular ones are.

9 hours ago, Rutabaga22 said:

Would it be okay legally if I distributed my gamedata for a multi-person project where I may have friends without ksp on the discord where I am distributing it? Without a working ksp install the gamedata should be useless, right?

We have bumped this question upstairs to the people that know, and they should get back us shortly.
I have decided to just have a modlist. It's a lot easier and less of a hassle.
